result.execSummary:
The defendant David D Ulsberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David D Ulsberger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David D Ulsberger was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF30 & 15CF438 called together at 2:38 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant David D Ulsberger in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement 

15CF438: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Ulsberger waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Ct#1 & Ct#3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining Counts

On Count #1-15CF30 & Counts #1 & #3-15CF438, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To pay restitution of $475 payable to Escape Teen Center, Fort Atkinson (15CF30)
--To pay restitution of $1408.09 payable to Dan's Washboard, Fort Atkinson (15CF438)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee (both cases)
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--Be subject to testing for illegal drugs and alcohol use as directed by Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand on each case
--To serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail (Ct#1-15CF30), with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment, education, treatment, therapy and counseling; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

Days credit for time already served: 12 days-15CF30
Days credit for time already served: 5 days-15CF438
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and denies expungement on Case 15CF438
Recess: 3:12 pm Reconvene: 3:12 pm 
Statements by Mr. Ulsberger
Recess: 3:13 pm

Cases 15CF30 and 15CF438 called together at 9:36am [mo]
Defendant David D Ulsberger in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to the State's Motion for Entry of Deferred Judgement on Case 15CF30
--Atty. Svehlek has no objection
The Court enters Judgment of Conviction in Case 15CF30

As to Case 15CF438:
Service of Amended Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited

Atty. Svehlek requests an additional status conference out 30 days
--no objection from ADA Hall 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
Bond Remains as Fixed

NEXT: JA: Case 15CF30 to be scheduled for Sentencing and Case 15CF438 to be scheduled for Status Conference out 30 days, allow 45 minutes
Stipulation and Order for Continuance is Granted
from the DA's Office to reschedule the pretrial conference
Notice of Motion and Motion for Entry of Deferred Judgments
for Entry of Deferred Judgments, State's

Case called at 10:45 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant David D Ulsberger in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that warrant was issued on State's request as Defendant had violated conditions of bond by commiting new crimes
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $500 CASH bond with conditions:
--no presence at 312 Bluff St., Fort Atkinson, WI.
--no contact with Eric Mc Daniel
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

Counsel request this case track with other pending felony matter
Recess: 10:49 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 2/22/16 at 3:00 pm

State's warrant request based upon Notice of Bond Violation(s.)
Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Order for Dismissal
with attached victim restitution request form(s)

Case called at 10:45 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant David D Ulsberger in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and WITHHOLDS ENTRY OF JUDGMENT FOR 12 MONTHS.
If DPA is revoked, Mr. Ulsberger will have 3 days credit for time served
Court approves the agreement, presents basis; finds that it is consistent with the defendant's rehabilatative needs - Count #2 is dismissed without prejudice
Court reminds Mr. Ulsberger that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while DPA is in effect - Court endorses order
Recess: 11:01 am

[Reserve Judge Sarah OBrien presiding for Branch IV]

Atty. Svehlek indicates that a resolution has been met, the agreement includes deferred prosecution; further she requests 5 weeks to allow drafting and approval of deferred prosecution agreement
--no objection from ADA Teuber
